tue.yellow

Class Nurse

  • java.lang.Object
    • tue.yellow.Nurse

  • public class Nurse
extends java.lang.Object
    Nurse is the class for the nurses in the emergency room. A nurse has a name, an indicator of their availability, an assigned patient, and a current activity.

    A nurse interacts with patients, in order to give treatment or perform triage.

    Author:
    Team Yellow

      2) list type of the nurse (meaning the emergency room of the nurse)
      This method adds the nurse to the list of the emergency room upon creation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Nurse

        public Nurse(java.lang.String staffName,
             ListTracker listTracker)
        Creates a nurse object, using two input values:
        1) name of the nurse
        2) list type of the nurse (meaning the emergency room of the nurse)
        This method adds the nurse to the list of the emergency room upon creation.

        Furthermore, the staff availability is set to NOT_AVAILABLE and current activity is set to "unknown". Also, upon creation, a nurse object is not related to a patient yet, so the assigned patient is null.

        Parameters:
        staffName - name of the nurse
        ListTracker - the list to which the nurse belongs

      • Nurse

        public Nurse(java.lang.String staffName)
        Creates a nurse object, using only as input the name of the nurse. This method doesn't add the nurse to the list of the emergency room upon creation.

        Furthermore, the staff availability is set to NOT_AVAILABLE and current activity is set to "unknown". Also, upon creation, a nurse object is not related to a patient yet, so the assigned patient is null.

        Parameters:
        staffName - name of the nurse

        Returns:
        the current activity of the nurse

      • setCurrentActivity

        public void setCurrentActivity(java.lang.String currentActivity)
        Sets the current activity of this nurse. When the nurse is currently at home, the staff availability will be set at NOT_AVAILABLE.
        Parameters:
        currentActivity - the current activity of the nurse

      • performTriage

        public void performTriage(Patient assignedPatient,
                          Bed.Zone zone,
                          Patient.TriageUrgency urgencyLevel)
        The nurse performs triage on a patient. This can only happen if the nurse is currently available, unassigned to a patient, and if that patient is not being triaged by another nurse.

        While performing triage, the nurse and patient are assigned to each other. Furthermore, the current status of the patient is UNDERGO_TRIAGE, while the nurse's activity will be "Performing triage", and the nurse's availability will be NOT_AVAILABLE.

        As input for this method, not only the patient on which the triage will be performed is needed, but also the resulting zone and urgency level of the triage.

        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient who will receive triage
        zone - the zone in which this patient should be treated, decided by this nurse
        urgencyLevel - the urgency level of this patient's triage, decided by this nurse

      • performClinicalExam

        public void performClinicalExam(Patient assignedPatient,
                                ListTracker lt)
        Performs a Clinical Examination on the patient, if the nurse is available to perform treatment, and the patient is not already treated by another nurse, and the patient is assigned to a bed.

        While performing Clinical Examination, the nurse and patient are assigned to each other, the current status of the patient is changed to IN_TREATMENT. The current activity of the nurse will be "Performing a Clinical Examination", while the nurse's availability will be NOT_AVAILABLE while performing this method.

        The nurse also requires a doctor for this treatment step. When calling this method, a nurse also takes the first available doctor and assigns him/her to this activity and patient as well. If there is no available doctor, this treatment cannot be performed.

        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient who will receive this Clinical Examination
        lt - the emergency room of the nurse and patient

      • performParametersMonitoring

        public void performParametersMonitoring(Patient assignedPatient)
        Performs a Parameters Monitoring on the patient, if the nurse is available to perform treatment, and the patient is not already treated by another nurse, and the patient is assigned to a bed.

        While performing Parameters Monitoring, the nurse and patient are assigned to each other, the current status of the patient is changed to IN_TREATMENT. The current activity of the nurse will be "Performing a Parameters Monitoring", while the nurse's availability will be NOT_AVAILABLE while performing this method.

        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient who will receive this Parameters Monitoring

      • performBloodSampling

        public void performBloodSampling(Patient assignedPatient)
        Performs a Blood Sampling on the patient, if the nurse is available to perform treatment, and the patient is not already treated by another nurse, and the patient is assigned to a bed.

        While performing Blood Sampling, the nurse and patient are assigned to each other, the current status of the patient is changed to IN_TREATMENT. The current activity of the nurse will be "Performing a Blood Sampling", while the nurse's availability will be "NOT_AVAILABLE" while performing this method.

        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient who will receive this Blood Sampling

      • performInternalMI

        public void performInternalMI(Patient assignedPatient)
        Performs an Internal Medical Imaging on the patient, if the nurse is available to perform treatment, and the patient is not already treated by another nurse, and the patient is assigned to a bed.

        While performing Internal Medical Imaging, the nurse and patient are assigned to each other, the current status of the patient is changed to IN_TREATMENT. The current activity of the nurse will be "Performing an Internal Medical Imaging", while the nurse's availability will be NOT_AVAILABLE while performing this method.

        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient who will receive this Internal Medical Imaging

      • performExternalMI

        public void performExternalMI(Patient assignedPatient,
                              ListTracker lt)
        Performs an External Medical Imaging on the patient, if the nurse is available to perform treatment, and the patient is not already treated by another nurse, and the patient is assigned to a bed.

        While performing External Medical Imaging, the nurse and patient are assigned to each other, the current status of the patient is changed to IN_TREATMENT. The current activity of the nurse will be "Performing an External Medical Imaging", while the nurse's availability will be NOT_AVAILABLE while performing this method.

        The nurse also requires a doctor for this treatment step. When calling this method, a nurse also takes the first available doctor and assigns him/her to this activity and patient as well. If there is no available doctor, this treatment cannot be performed.

        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient who will receive this External Medical Imaging
        lt - the emergency room of the nurse and patient

      • performMedication

        public void performMedication(Patient assignedPatient,
                              ListTracker lt)
        Performs a Medication on the patient, if the nurse is available to perform treatment, and the patient is not already treated by another nurse, and the patient is assigned to a bed.

        While performing Medication, the nurse and patient are assigned to each other, the current status of the patient is changed to IN_TREATMENT. The current activity of the nurse will be "Performing a Medication", while the nurse's availability will be NOT_AVAILABLE while performing this method.

        The nurse also requires a doctor for this treatment step. When calling this method, a nurse also takes the first available doctor and assigns him/her to this activity and patient as well. If there is no available doctor, this treatment cannot be performed.

        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient who will receive this Medication
        lt - the emergency room of the nurse and patient

      • performOtherExamTreatment

        public void performOtherExamTreatment(Patient assignedPatient,
                                      ListTracker lt)
        Performs an Other Examination and Treatment on the patient, if the nurse is available to perform treatment, and the patient is not already treated by another nurse, and the patient is assigned to a bed.

        While performing Other Examination and Treatment, the nurse and patient are assigned to each other, the current status of the patient is changed to IN_TREATMENT. The current activity of the nurse will be "Performing an Other Examination and Treatment", while the nurse's availability will be NOT_AVAILABLE while performing this method.

        The nurse also requires a doctor for this treatment step. When calling this method, a nurse also takes the first available doctor and assigns him/her to this activity and patient as well. If there is no available doctor, this treatment cannot be performed.

        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient who will receive this Other Examination and Treatment
        lt - the emergency room of the nurse and patient

      • performDischarge

        public void performDischarge(Patient assignedPatient,
                             ListTracker lt)
        Performs a Discharge on the patient, if the nurse is available to perform treatment, and the patient is not already treated by another nurse, and the patient is assigned to a bed.

        While performing Discharge, the nurse and patient are assigned to each other, the current status of the patient is changed to IN_DISCHARGE. The current activity of the nurse will be "Performing a Discharge", while the nurse's availability will be NOT_AVAILABLE while performing this method.

        The nurse also requires a doctor for this treatment step. When calling this method, a nurse also takes the first available doctor and assigns him/her to this activity and patient as well. If there is no available doctor, this treatment cannot be performed.

        If the patient is still sick when discharge is performed, the patient will wait for boarding. If he/she is healthy, the patient will leave the emergency room immediately.

        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient who will receive this Discharge
        lt - the emergency room of the nurse and patient

      • performBoarding

        public void performBoarding(Patient assignedPatient)
        Performs Boarding on the patient, if the nurse is available to perform treatment, and the patient is not already treated by another nurse, and the patient is assigned to a bed.

        While performing Boarding, the nurse and patient are assigned to each other, the current status of the patient is changed to BOARDING. The current activity of the nurse will be "Performing boarding", while the nurse's availability will be NOT_AVAILABLE while performing this method. During this method, the patient will leave the emergency room.

        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient who will receive this Other Examination and Treatment

      • finishTreatment

        public void finishTreatment(Patient assignedPatient,
                            Patient.HealthStatus healthStatus)
        Finishes treatment and gives a health status to this patient. Treatment can only be finished if the nurse is assigned to that patient, meaning that a treatment step has to be started and finished by the same nurse. The nurse gives an assessment of the health status after the treatment, and assigns this to the patient. The patient's status will be WAITING after treatment, and the staff member will become AVAILABLE again. After finishing treatment, the nurse will retreat to the staff room (current activity: "In the staff room").

        When the nurse is performing a treatment step together with the doctor, calling the method finishTreatment() will also release the doctor from this patient, as the doctor and nurse finish treatment at the same time.

        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient whose treatment will be finished
        healthStatus - the assessment from the nurse given to the patient following the treatment

      • finishTriage

        public void finishTriage(Patient assignedPatient,
                         Patient.HealthStatus healthStatus)
        Finishes triage and gives a health status to this patient. Triage can only be finished if the nurse is assigned to that patient, meaning that a triage has to be started and finished by the same nurse. The nurse gives an assessment of the health status after the triage, and assigns this to the patient. The patient's status will be WAITING_FOR_BED after triage, and the staff member will become AVAILABLE again. After finishing triage, the nurse will retreat to the staff room (current activity: "In the staff room").
        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient whose treatment will be finished
        healthStatus - the assessment from the nurse given to the patient following the treatment

      • releasePatient

        public void releasePatient(Patient assignedPatient)
        When a treatment or a triage is finished, the patient should not be assigned to the nurse anymore. Only the patient who has been currently assigned to the nurse can be released in this method.
        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient to be released from the nurse

      • calmPatient

        public void calmPatient(Patient assignedPatient)
        A nurse will be assigned to the patient in the callNurseList to calm the patient. After being assigned a nurse, the patient will be removed from the callNurseList.
        Parameters:
        assignedPatient -

      • checkOnPatient

        public void checkOnPatient(Patient assignedPatient,
                           Patient.TriageUrgency urgencyLevel)
        When a patient gets sicker, a nurse will be assigned to this patient to redo triage, as it could happen that the urgency level has changed. This method can only happen after triage, as otherwise there is no reference point as to what was the initial 'sickness' (urgency).
        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient who will receive the check
        urgencyLevel - the urgency level of this patient, can be decided and changed by nurse

      • finishCheck

        public void finishCheck(Patient assignedPatient,
                        Patient.HealthStatus healthStatus)
        Finishes a check and gives a health status to this patient. A check can only be finished if the nurse is assigned to that patient, meaning that a check has to be started and finished by the same nurse. The nurse gives an assessment of the health status after the check, and assigns this to the patient. The patient's status will be WAITING after check, and the staff member will become AVAILABLE again. After finishing check, the nurse will retreat to the staff room (current activity: "In the staff room").
        Parameters:
        assignedPatient - the patient whose treatment will be finished
        healthStatus - the assessment from the nurse given to the patient following the treatment

      • goHome

        public void goHome()
        When a nurse goes home, he/she is not available anymore to perform treatment. This method sets his/her availability to NOT_AVAILABLE.

      • startWork

        public void startWork()
        When a nurse starts work, he/she is available to perform treatment. This method sets his/her availability to AVAILABLE.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Displays the information of a nurse object
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Nurse information: name, availability, assigned patient, current activity
